entries.title: Automated Hair Journey Entry – 2025-09-29 11:48:12
entries.content: The hair is short, coily (4A), and appears to be of medium texture and high density. Hydration is moderate, with some frizz visible. The scalp appears healthy. Recommendations include moisturizing shampoo and conditioner, leave-in conditioner, weekly deep conditioning treatments, and night time protection to improve hydration and reduce frizz.
entries.products: Shea Moisture Coconut & Hibiscus Curl & Shine Shampoo, Cantu Shea Butter Leave-In Conditioning Repair Cream, Mielle Organics Babassu Oil & Mint Deep Conditioner

entries.title: Testing this time
entries.content: Since you no longer need a separate page with the modal form, I'll integrate the "Add Entry" modal directly into the shortcode, ensuring all functionality (including form submission) is handled within the same template.

entries.title: Knotless Braids Install – Low Maintenance Vibes
entries.content: Got knotless box braids installed today! I chose this protective style to give my natural hair a break and to minimize manipulation for the next few weeks. Went with waist-length, medium-sized parts for a clean, versatile look. The install took about 5 hours but was so worth it. Can’t wait to explore different updos and bun styles!

entries.title: Wash Day + Curl Definition Routine – Embracing My Natural Texture
entries.content: Today was all about giving my curls the love they deserve. I did a full wash day routine focused on moisture and curl definition. I’m learning to embrace my natural texture more and more, and today’s results were the best yet—defined, bouncy, and soft coils with minimal frizz. I also tried a new gel that didn’t flake!

entries.title: First Silk Press in 6 Months – Fall Refresh
entries.content: Today marked a big milestone in my natural hair journey—I got my first silk press in over 6 months! I’ve been focusing on protective styles all year, so this was a great opportunity to check on my hair’s health, length retention, and overall progress. I also trimmed about half an inch to get rid of some split ends and refresh the shape.
